metadata.dc:author: Vallcanera, A
Lanuza, A
Páramo, C
Villanueva, A
Olagüe, R
Gracía, A
metadata.dc:description: A three-month old asymptomatic infant was incidentally found to have an abdominal mass. Through standard radiological and vascular procedures it was defined as being of hepatic origin, vascular etiology and of benign prognosis. Differences among cavernous hemangioma, hepatoma, metastasis and hemangio-endothelioma are summarized. The importance of angiography is emphasized as an essential procedure previous to the surgical evaluation and therapy.
metadata.dc:title: Hemangioma cavernoso hepático.
[Cavernous hemangioma of the liver (author's transl)].
